channel.title: Network Analysis on Columbia DSI Scholars
channel.description: Recent content in Network Analysis on Columbia DSI Scholars

item.title: Project: A longitudinal network study of Alzheimer’s and dementia care in relation to disparities and outcomes
item.description: Alzheimer’s disease and related dementia (AD/dementia) represent a looming public health crisis, affecting roughly 5 million people in the U.S. and 11% of older adults. As with other chronic conditions, racial/ethnic and socio-economic disparities exist in the prevalence and burden of illness. However, less is known about how disparities in access to care influence the care trajectories – i.e. the scope, frequency and sequence of services used across health care settings – of those with AD/dementia.
